snippet: A letter from the defense secretary tries to stop military lawyers from using “unlawful command influence” to prevent sexual assault prosecutions.
abstract: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel, in an effort to stop military lawyers from using Obama's comments to prevent sexual assault prosecutions, sends out directive ordering military to exercise independent judgement in cases and effectively ignore the president's remarks.
lead_paragraph: A letter from the defense secretary tries to stop military lawyers from using “unlawful command influence” to prevent sexual assault prosecutions.

headline.main: Hagel Tries to Blunt Effect of Obama Words on Sexual Assault Cases
headline.print_headline: Hagel Tries to Blunt Effect of Obama Words on Sex Assault Cases

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
